pros: Learning how to manage account and people of course
cons: It is the biggest problem for me "location"

pros: You are able to meet so many people from another cities and universties while working with.
Corporate Firm so laws are obeyed

review_title: Being a part of this network is good opportunity to discover new cultures and improve communication skills.
pros: Meeting new people, having connections all over the World, time management, gaining self confidence, improving language and communication skills, discovering new cultures, crisis management, making decisions properly and quickly
cons: For students, studying and working at the same time in this network can be tiring but I strongly recommend to take role for self development.

pros: I've been volunteering for ESN for one and half year . I could absolutely tell that it is the best decision of my university life. All the experiences that you face in the organisation help your communication skills, give you an transnational identity. You learn how to motivate people and being a good team member beside leading them.
cons: Sometimes it takes a lot of time and patience.

pros: ESN is a non-profit international student organisation. Our mission is to represent international students, thus provide opportunities for cultural understanding and self-development under the principle of Students Helping Students.
Its great organisation working as a volunteer. You can learn lots of things and also take responsibilities.
cons: There is no cons. Everything is great:)
